The White House will not share your email address with persons or organizations outside the Executive Office of the President, and you can unsubscribe from updates at any time. Learn more at WhiteHouse.gov/Privacy.

Joplin One Year Later

To mark the anniversary of the Joplin tornado, we talked to some of those who've witnessed and contributed the city's remarkable recovery. See how far they’ve come.

  • Watch the Video
  • Learn More

G8 Summit at Camp David

This weekend, the leaders of Britain, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, and Russia joined President Obama at Camp David

  • More Information
  • View the Gallery
President Obama participates in the G8 Summit family photo., White House Photo, Chuck Kennedy, 5/19/12

Weekly Address

President Obama discusses the reforms to Wall Street that he put in place to protect consumers and make Wall Street play by the same set of rules -- and calls on lawmakers to finish implementing these reforms.

  • Watch the Video
President Barack Obama tapes the weekly address. (Official White House Photo by Lawrence Jackson), 5/16/12

West Wing Week

This week, the President discussed his plan to help responsible homeowners, honored law enforcement officers, awarded the Medal of Honor and continued to call on Congress to act on a “To Do List”

  • Watch the Video

Featured Topics

  • April Jobs Numbers

    Private sector employment rose by 130,000 jobs in April. The economy has added private sector jobs for 26 straight months, for a total of more than 4.25 million payroll jobs over that period.

    Learn More

    We want to hear from you. Learn how you can get involved, share your stories, and add your voice to help address the challenges of the 21st century.

  • One Year Anniversary of Joining Forces

    First Lady Michelle Obama revealed that 60,000 servicemen and women and their spouses have been hired through Joining Forces employment initiatives

    Enter a few pieces of information about your taxes, and the taxpayer receipt will calculate how your federal tax dollars are spent.

  • The End of the Iraq War

    After nearly nine years, the war in Iraq is coming to an end, and our troops are coming home. Check out a timeline of the events that helped to bring the war to a close and learn more about President Obama's efforts to fight for veterans.

    Learn More

  • West Wing Week

    This week, the President discussed his plan to help responsible homeowners, honored law enforcement officers, awarded the Medal of Honor and continued to call on Congress to act on a “To Do List”

  • We the People

    In a response to We the People petitions about SOPA and online piracy, officials from the Obama Administration stress that the important task of protecting intellectual property online must not threaten an open and innovative Internet.

    Learn More

  • Joining Forces

    The President, Vice President, First Lady and Dr. Jill Biden launch the national initiative to support and honor America's service members and their families.

    Learn More
    • back
    • next

  • March Jobs Numbers

    Overall payroll employment rose by 121,000 jobs in March. The economy has added private sector jobs for 25 straight months, for a total of more than 4.1 million payroll jobs over that period.

    Learn More
    • back
    • next

  • Day of Service

    Dr. Martin Luther King called service the “new definition of greatness” and to mark the holiday that honors his contributions to America, the First and Second Families joined volunteers in projects to improve local communities

    Learn More
    • back
    • next

  • What 40 Dollars Means

    You spoke out, and it made all the difference. The payroll tax cut will be extended.

    The holiday theme this year is "Shine, Give, Share." You're invited to check out the decorations, share a message of thanks with the troops, and see scenes from Christmas and Hanukkah celebrations at the White House.

    Looking to find out how the American Jobs Act will put more people back to work and put more money in the pockets of working Americans? These helpful links have all the information you need.

  • Judicial Delays

    The delays President Obama's judicial nominees are encountering on Capitol Hill are unprecedented. Take a look at our infographic that explains the confirmation process and highlights the bottleneck.

  • The Latest News on Jobs

    Private sector payrolls increased by 227,000 jobs in February. The economy has added private sector jobs for 24 straight months, for a total of 3.9 million payroll jobs over that period.

    Learn More
    • back
    • next

  • Resources on the Debate About our National Debt

    This compromise guarantees more than $2 trillion in deficit reduction, and will ensure that as a nation we live within our means, while still making key investments in things that lead to new jobs, like education and research.

    Learn More
    • back
    • next

  • White House mobile apps

    With both an iPhone and Android mobile app, Americans can get alerts directly from the White House, check out behind-the-scenes photos and videos, and read the latest news from the blog or the Briefing Room.

    Learn More
    • back
    • next

  • President Names Richard Cordray to Lead New Agency

    President Obama has chosen a former Ohio Attorney General to head the CFPB, a new agency established to arm Americans with the information they need to make smart financial decisions, which launched Thursday, July 21

    The health reform law, the Affordable Care Act, is making a difference in the lives of millions of Americans like Erick Moberg. He discusses it in a surprise phone call from the President.

    President tour areas damaged by Hurricane Irene and reassures residents that the federal, state and local governments will be there to help them rebuild.

The Blog

  • May 22, 2012 at 6:09 PM EDT

    An Ongoing Commitment, a Bright Future

    AmeriCorps members, including Darla Armstrong, have made a long term commitment to help Joplin recover from the tornado.

  • May 22, 2012 at 3:59 PM EDT

    Ask an Entrepreneur: How Do Small Businesses Benefit from Federal Research Grants?

  • May 22, 2012 at 3:56 PM EDT

    Behind the Scenes: Burt Bacharach and Hal David Receive the Gershwin Prize

    One of America's most successful songwriting teams was honored with a concert in the East Room

    Includes Video
  • May 22, 2012 at 3:22 PM EDT

    Number of the Day: 82 years

    In the year since the storm, more than 126,800 individuals put in some 755,300 hours of community service in the Joplin area

  • May 22, 2012 at 2:09 PM EDT

    My First Job: Andy Katz

    Andy Katz, a sports reporter and analyst, talks about his first job at a sporting goods store.

    Includes Video
  • May 22, 2012 at 1:45 PM EDT

    JudyCare: Focusing on Fighting Cancer, Without Fear of Lifetime Insurance Caps

    For Judy Lamb, a breast cancers patient from Colorado, the Affordable Care Act removed a tremendous burden: the fear that her health plan would stop paying for her treatments.

    Includes Video

Featured Legislation

  • Jumpstart Our Business Startups Act

    Signed: Thursday, April 5, 2012

  • Stop Trading on Congressional Knowledge Act of 2012

    Signed: Wednesday, April 4, 2012

  • Middle Class Tax Relief and Job Creation Act of 2012

    Signed: Wednesday, February 22, 2012

  • Temporary Payroll Tax Cut Continuation Act of 2011

    Signed: Friday, December 23, 2011

  • United States-Colombia Trade Promotion Agreement Implementation Act

    Signed: Friday, October 21, 2011

  • United States-Panama Trade Promotion Agreement Implementation Act

    Signed: Friday, October 21, 2011

  • United States-Korea Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act

    Signed: Friday, October 21, 2011

  • America Invents Act

    Signed: Friday, September 16, 2011

  • Budget Control Act of 2011

    Signed: Tuesday, August 2, 2011

  • FDA Food Safety Modernization Act

    Signed: Tuesday, January 4, 2011

  • James Zadroga 9/11 Health and Compensation Act of 2010

    Signed: Sunday, January 2, 2011

  • Don't Ask, Don't Tell Repeal Act of 2010

    Signed: Wednesday, December 22, 2010
